events.name: Book Club: Seven Languages in Seven Weeks – Scala
events.description:
Read Seven Languages in Seven Weeks. This week we'll be covering the chapters on Scala.  


"Just as each new spoken language can make you smarter and increase your options, each programming language increases your mental tool kit, adding new abstractions you can throw at each new problem. " How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Bring snacks and drinks of your choice! Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Virtual Reality Innovations in 2016: New Devices to Storytelling
events.description:
http://www2.blk71.com/startup-events UPDATED: We’ve managed to line up a very broad and diverse list of guest presenters and speakers for this month’s Meetup. From the impact of VR on storytelling, education and sports through to new eye tracking tech and the recent launch of the HTC Vive, this session will appeal to developers, technologists, content creators and VR / 360 degree video enthusiasts wanting to learn more about the latest innovations and approaches. Or simply those who just to hangout with like-minded people who want to change the world! Presentations will include an overview of: • The future of sports and Virtual Reality • VR Storytelling: 360 degree video production and Samsung Gear demo • What VR means for education and learning • UX design for VR and 360 video • New Oculus Rift 2K2 eye tracking integration demo • HTC Vive / Project Tango+Cardboard demo. It’s going to be an amazing night ahead so please sign up early, as there will be limited spaces. We’ll have a hard start at 7 pm and aim to wrap-up at around 9 pm. AGENDA 7.00pm - Introduction / AsiaVR Updates from Jia and Don A quick intro of AsiaVR and our plans. 7.05 pm - “The Future of Sports and Virtual Reality” -Maurizio Barbieri, Head of Sports, Samsung Asia A highly passionate VR advocate and tech entrepreneur in his own right, Maurizio will share his perspective on the possibilities for rich and immersive experiences to come for sports fans, athletes, content creators and broadcasters. Here's a  sample post from Maurizio. 7.25 pm - “Against Blue Current: What VR Means for Storytelling” - Ender Jiang and Hiverlab Ender and team will explain how they produce 360 video and what the integration of new technologies will mean to the evolution of VR storytelling. They’ll also demo their latest project, ’Against Blue Current’, by providing hands-on experience with the Samsung Gear VR. Here’s a preview.  7.45 pm - “Project Arctic: VR and Education” - Li Shaohuan / Vito Technologies VR is changing the way knowledge can be delivered through 3D immersive content. Shaohuan will share more details about his new VR education startup, Vito Technologies, that he's building with partner Jiang Kuo, and how they are adopting VR into education and learning initiatives. They’ll also provide a demo of their latest project, ‘Project Arctic’. Check out a preview here. 8.05 pm - “Designing for VR: User Experience Principles to Consider” - Khai Seng Hong / Foolproof Khai Seng from the Singapore team of UX design agency Foolproof will share their team's learnings in designing for frictionless and user friendly experiences and how that can be applied to VR and 360 video. 8.20 pm - “Bringing Virtual Reality to the Next Level: Oculus Rift DK2 and Eye Tracking” - Fan Jie / Newrocare Technology Fan Jie will explain what new eye tracking technology means to virtual reality, particularly its integration within the Oculus Rift DK2. He’ll also provide a demo and trial of this new technology. 8.35 pm - HTC Vive / Project Tango+Cardboard demo - Jia Hen / VRcollab.com Naturally we saved a very special experience to last — everyone is invited to join Jia at his office to demo the new HTC Vive, learn more about Project Tango and upcoming VR events for the developer community. Jia will also be showing a cool new VR beach demo that he and his team have created: https://www.facebook.com/wizz.tee/videos/10153599932558732/ See you on March 15 at NUS Enterprise@Blk71! The AsiaVR Association is a non-profit association focused on promoting dialogue, debate, collaboration and investment in this rapidly evolving area of technology innovation. Our members come from a wide variety of disciplines, including user interface and application development through to VR documentary filmmaking and branded content creation. We welcome anyone interested in contributing to the discussion, or just wanting to come up to speed on this exciting new area, to join us. Do join our discussion in our facebook group. We normally held small meetup over there . https://www.facebook.com/groups/asiavr/ In partnership with:  


For more information: http://www2.blk71.com/startup-events
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality meetup
